channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Orgs demand action to mitigate AI’s environmental harm
item.description: A group of more than 100 organizations has published an open letter calling on the AI industry and regulators to mitigate the tech’s harmful environme...

item.title: Carried interest repeal could stifle investments in startups, NVCA says

item.title: Feds Halt the National Electric Vehicle Charging Program
item.description: The US government has ordered states to retract their plans to build hundreds of federally funded EV charging stations, according to a memo obtained b...

item.title: The US Treasury Claimed DOGE Technologist Didn’t Have ‘Write Access’ When He Actually Did
item.description: Sources tell WIRED that the ability of DOGE’s Marko Elez to alter code controlling trillions in federal spending was rescinded days after US Treasury ...

item.title: Elon Musk’s DOGE Is Working on a Custom Chatbot Called GSAi
item.description: The chatbot is part of Elon Musk and President Donald Trump’s ambitions to use AI and other technologies to cut costs and modernize the US government.

item.title: E3’s Organizers Are Back With a New Event. This Time, Doctors Are Invited Too

item.title: Report: OpenAI’s ex-CTO, Mira Murati, has recruited OpenAI co-founder John Schulman
item.description: OpenAI co-founder John Schulman, who left AI startup Anthropic last week after a mere five months, is reportedly joining former OpenAI CTO Mira Murati...

item.title: Amazon doubles down on AI with a massive $100B spending plan for 2025

item.title: Sprinklr cuts 500 employees, citing underwhelming business performance
item.description: Sprinklr has cut 15% of its workforce — around 500 employees — due to business performance not meeting expectations. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights res...

item.title: Donald Trump's NIH Pick Just Launched a Controversial Scientific Journal
